answers.answer_a: HTTP middleware is a technique for installing Laravel via HTTP.
answers.answer_b: HTTP middleware is a technique for filtering HTTP requests.

Which of the following are true for routes in Laravel?

answers.answer_a: You can not pass any arguments to your routes.
answers.answer_b: Routes can point to a method on a controller and also dictate which HTTP methods are able to hit that URI.
answers.answer_c: A route is an endpoint specified by a URI (Uniform Resource Identifier).
answers.answer_d: Routes can only handle GET requests
